section.name: DSL-Oriented API
section.p: FEST-Swing exploits the concept of Internal Domain-Specific Language to provide an easy and simple way to create and maintain GUI functional tests. Although we might argue that it is not possible to create domain-specific languages (DSLs) with the Java language, designing an API from a DSL perspective can result in an APIthat is both easy to read and write.

Not every class in FEST-Swing follows this programming style. Only the classes intended for be used to create GUI tests, that is, the classes in the package org.fest.swing.fixture, were created in with a DSL style in mind.
